headline: Northeast hardest hit as B.C. wildfire season gets underway | CBC News
context: Jon Azpiri | Last updated: Friday at 8:31 p.m. PT

The Naver Creek wildfire is 53 kilometres south of Prince George, near the unincorporated community of Hixon, and has the potential to impact Highway 97, according to the B.C. Wildfire Service (BCWS). It says 19 personnel, along with helicopters and airtankers, are on site to support the Hixon Fire Department.

annotations.paragraph: The BCWS is also responding to the Wolverine River wildfire, which was discovered 12 kilometres southwest of Tumbler Ridge.

annotations.paragraph: It says the fire is estimated to be 15 hectares in size, but is expected to grow given site conditions and strong winds from an incoming cold front.
